RumorFact.Text: A Nomai named Kousa left a scroll in the Hanging City that goes into more detail about the storm shelter.

ExploreFact.Text: A pair of artificial gravity highways that allows one to ascend the Hanging City's districts.
I found a conversation detailing the incomplete construction of the White Hole Station. Its warp receiver was planned to be constructed on the surface above the Hanging City.
A warp transmitter requires a connected warp receiver to function.
Storm shelters were engineered to protect Nomai on an expedition to Giant's Deep, by generating a gravity field when islands are lifted into space.
The Sunless City contributed to the invention of the storm shelter, allowing the device to autonomously power on and off.

RumorFact.Text: Gravity crystals used to build the Orbital Probe Cannon were sourced from this workshop on Brittle Hollow.
The Nomai on Giant's Deep visited this workshop on Brittle Hollow's equator to inquire about storm shelters activating in the absence of cyclones.

ExploreFact.Text: Gravity crystals were crafted from fragments of Brittle Hollow's crust and stored at this workshop.
An invention called the storm shelter was engineered at this workshop to help Nomai weather storms on their expedition.
Storm shelters are powered by solar panels, not cyclones.
Nomai on Giant's Deep reported some sort of issue with the storm shelter when the sun was directly overhead.

AltText.Text: The solar panels powering the storm shelters are tuned to detect even faint amounts of sunlight, causing storm shelters to activate when the sun is directly overhead.

ExploreFact.Text: Feldspar discovered gravity crystals here on their first expedition into space. They wanted to bring one home, but were unable to find any available crystals at this site.
